body:
In about 100 test runs overnight, 5 clusters failed with the same problem:
Nodes try to register with the apiserver, apiserver sends back a 500.
Looking at the kube-apiserver logs, I see:

```
E0619 20:37:50.685032       5 errors.go:62] apiserver received an error that is not an api.Status: 501: All the given peers are not reachable (failed to propose on members [http://127.0.0.1:4001] twice [last error: Unexp
ected HTTP status code]) [0]
I0619 20:37:50.685229       5 handlers.go:135] POST /api/v1/namespaces: (12.228060557s) 500
...
E0619 20:37:50.643558       5 errors.go:62] apiserver received an error that is not an api.Status: 501: All the given peers are not reachable (failed to propose on members [http://127.0.0.1:4001] twice [last error: Unexp
ected HTTP status code]) [0]
I0619 20:37:50.643762       5 handlers.go:135] POST /api/v1/nodes: (12.228247163s) 500
```

To me, that looks like writes to etcd are failing. Looking into the etcd container logs, I see a lot of:

```
2015/06/19 20:40:38 etcdhttp: unexpected error: etcdserver: request timed out
2015/06/19 20:40:38 etcdhttp: unexpected error: etcdserver: request timed out
2015/06/19 20:40:38 etcdserver: publish error: etcdserver: request timed out
2015/06/19 20:40:38 etcdhttp: unexpected error: etcdserver: request timed out
2015/06/19 20:40:41 etcdhttp: unexpected error: etcdserver: request timed out
2015/06/19 20:40:41 etcdhttp: unexpected error: etcdserver: request timed out
2015/06/19 20:40:42 etcdhttp: unexpected error: etcdserver: request timed out
2015/06/19 20:40:43 etcdhttp: unexpected error: etcdserver: request timed out
2015/06/19 20:40:43 etcdhttp: unexpected error: etcdserver: request timed out
2015/06/19 20:40:43 etcdhttp: unexpected error: etcdserver: request timed out
2015/06/19 20:40:43 etcdserver: publish error: etcdserver: request timed out
2015/06/19 20:40:44 etcdhttp: unexpected error: etcdserver: request timed out
2015/06/19 20:40:44 etcdhttp: unexpected error: etcdserver: request timed out
2015/06/19 20:40:44 etcdhttp: unexpected error: etcdserver: request timed out
2015/06/19 20:40:47 etcdhttp: unexpected error: etcdserver: request timed out
2015/06/19 20:40:47 etcdhttp: unexpected error: etcdserver: request timed out
2015/06/19 20:40:47 etcdhttp: unexpected error: etcdserver: request timed out
```

Trying to hit etcd directly:

```
# curl -L http://127.0.0.1:4001/v2/keys/message -XPUT -d value="Hello world"
{"message":"Internal Server Error"}
```

Etcd's data directory is pretty empty, other than one entry in members/wal, so I tried listing members:

```
# curl http://127.0.0.1:4001/v2/members
{"members":[]}
```

In a working cluster, that looks more like:

```
# curl http://127.0.0.1:4001/v2/members
{"members":[{"id":"ce2a822cea30bfca","name":"default","peerURLs":["http://localhost:2380","http://localhost:7001"],"clientURLs":["http://127.0.0.1:4001"]}]}
```

I'm about at the extent of my etcd knowledge, so if anybody has any idea what else to poke at, I'd love to hear it.

labels.description: Highest priority. Must be actively worked on as someone's top priority right now.
labels.name: priority/critical-urgent

labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG Cluster Lifecycle.
labels.name: sig/cluster-lifecycle

milestone.description: Issues that need to be resolved for v1.0 of Kubernetes.
milestone.title: v1.0

title: kube-apiserver unable to write to etcd
